oai_dc:dc.dc:title: INFLUENCE OF NUTRIENT SOURCES AND INCLUSION OF MUNGBEAN ON PRODUCTIVITY, SOIL FERTILITY AND PROFITABILITY OF ORGANIC RICE-WHEAT CROPPING SYSTEM
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kumar, Dinesh
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop combinations and interactions
Soil biology
Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Composting and manuring
Nutrient turnover
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: On the basis of seven years of field investigation we conclude that inclusion of mungbean in rice-wheat cropping system (RWCS) enhanced grain yield, soil fertility and profits over RWCS. Use of FYM with crop residues and biofertilizers gave maximum profits and sustained soil fertility.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kumar, Dinesh (2014) INFLUENCE OF NUTRIENT SOURCES AND INCLUSION OF MUNGBEAN ON PRODUCTIVITY, SOIL FERTILITY AND PROFITABILITY OF ORGANIC RICE-WHEAT CROPPING SYSTEM. In: Rahmann, G. and Aksoy, U. (Eds.) Building Organic Bridges, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut, Braunschweig, Germany, 2, Thuenen Report, no. 20, pp. 655-658.
